page.title: 09MARYPORT + CARLISLE RAILWAY
page.content: This line was built to develop the west cumberland coalfield.in 1836 George Stevenson visited maryport to survey the line as chief consultant engineer.it was opened in stages between 1840-45 from Maryport to Carlisle via Aspatria and it never breaks the 500ft contour line.the first section opened in 1840 to Arkleby.then in 1841another section went to Aspatria.at Maryport they built their own locomotives. the original stations were Maryport, Bullgill,Arkleby,Aspatria and Carlisle stations were modernised in the early 19 hundreds but trade did not improve because of the decline in the coal and iron industries and in 1923 the company was amalgamated into the LMS and after nationalisation it was controlled by british railways.diesel multiple units now take passengers.
